intro: Collinsia sparsiflora var. collina, commonly known as the Sierra larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, such as meadows and slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its drought tolerance. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
